13#undef TYPE
14#define TYPE UNION
15static
16#include "has_single_reference_templ.c"
17
18__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,cow)(__isl_take UNION *u);
19
20isl_ctx *FN(UNION,get_ctx)(__isl_keep UNION *u)
21{
22 return u ? u->space->ctx : NULL;
23}
24
25/* Return the space of "u".
26 */
27static __isl_keep isl_space *FN(UNION,peek_space)(__isl_keep UNION *u)
28{
29 if (!u)
30 return NULL;
31 return u->space;
32}
33
34/* Return a copy of the space of "u".
35 */
36__isl_give isl_space *FN(UNION,get_space)(__isl_keep UNION *u)
37{
38 return isl_space_copy(FN(UNION,peek_space)(u));
39}
40
41/* Return the number of parameters of "u", where "type"
42 * is required to be set to isl_dim_param.
43 */
44isl_size FN(UNION,dim)(__isl_keep UNION *u, enum isl_dim_type type)
45{
46 if (!u)
47 return isl_size_error;
48
49 if (type != isl_dim_param)
50 isl_die(FN(UNION,get_ctx)(u), isl_error_invalid,
51 "can only reference parameters", return isl_size_error);
52
53 return isl_space_dim(u->space, type);
54}
55
56/* Return the position of the parameter with the given name
57 * in "u".
58 * Return -1 if no such dimension can be found.
59 */
60int FN(UNION,find_dim_by_name)(__isl_keep UNION *u, enum isl_dim_type type,
61 const char *name)
62{
63 if (!u)
64 return -1;
65 return isl_space_find_dim_by_name(u->space, type, name);
66}
67
68#include "opt_type.h"
69
70static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,alloc)(__isl_take isl_space *space
71 OPT_TYPE_PARAM, int size)
72{
73 UNION *u;
74
75 space = isl_space_params(space);
76 if (!space)
77 return NULL;
78
79 u = isl_calloc_type(space->ctx, UNION);
80 if (!u)
81 goto error;
82
83 u->ref = 1;
84 OPT_SET_TYPE(u->, type);
85 u->space = space;
86 if (isl_hash_table_init(space->ctx, &u->table, size) < 0)
87 return FN(UNION,free)(u);
88
89 return u;
90error:
91 isl_space_free(space);
92 return NULL;
93}
94
95/* Create an empty/zero union without specifying any parameters.
96 */
97__isl_give UNION *FN(FN(UNION,ZERO),ctx)(isl_ctx *ctx OPT_TYPE_PARAM)
98{
99 isl_space *space;
100
101 space = isl_space_unit(ctx);
102 return FN(FN(UNION,ZERO),space)(space OPT_TYPE_ARG(NO_LOC));
103}
104
105__isl_give UNION *FN(FN(UNION,ZERO),space)(__isl_take isl_space *space
106 OPT_TYPE_PARAM)
107{
108 return FN(UNION,alloc)(space OPT_TYPE_ARG(NO_LOC), 16);
109}
110
111/* This is an alternative name for the function above.
112 */
113__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,ZERO)(__isl_take isl_space *space OPT_TYPE_PARAM)
114{
115 return FN(FN(UNION,ZERO),space)(space OPT_TYPE_ARG(NO_LOC));
116}
117
118__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,copy)(__isl_keep UNION *u)
119{
120 if (!u)
121 return NULL;
122
123 u->ref++;
124 return u;
125}
126
127/* Do the tuples of "space" correspond to those of the domain of "part"?
128 * That is, is the domain space of "part" equal to "space", ignoring parameters?
129 */
130static isl_bool FN(PART,has_domain_space_tuples)(__isl_keep PART *part,
131 __isl_keep isl_space *space)
132{
133 return isl_space_has_domain_tuples(space, FN(PART,peek_space)(part));
134}
135
136/* Extract the element of "u" living in "space" (ignoring parameters).
137 *
138 * Return the ZERO element if "u" does not contain any element
139 * living in "space".
140 */
141__isl_give PART *FN(FN(UNION,extract),BASE)(__isl_keep UNION *u,
142 __isl_take isl_space *space)
143{
144 struct isl_hash_table_entry *entry;
145
146 entry = FN(UNION,find_part_entry)(u, space, 0);
147 if (!entry)
148 goto error;
149 if (entry == isl_hash_table_entry_none)
150 return FN(PART,ZERO)(space OPT_TYPE_ARG(u->));
151 isl_space_free(space);
152 return FN(PART,copy)(entry->data);
153error:
154 isl_space_free(space);
155 return NULL;
156}
157
158/* Add "part" to "u".
159 * If "disjoint" is set, then "u" is not allowed to already have
160 * a part that is defined over a domain that overlaps with the domain
161 * of "part".
162 * Otherwise, compute the union sum of "part" and the part in "u"
163 * defined on the same space.
164 */
165static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,add_part_generic)(__isl_take UNION *u,
166 __isl_take PART *part, int disjoint)
167{
168 int empty;
169 struct isl_hash_table_entry *entry;
170
171 if (!part)
172 goto error;
173
174 empty = FN(PART,IS_ZERO)(part);
175 if (empty < 0)
176 goto error;
177 if (empty) {
178 FN(PART,free)(part);
179 return u;
180 }
181
182 u = FN(UNION,align_params)(u, FN(PART,get_space)(part));
183 part = FN(PART,align_params)(part, FN(UNION,get_space)(u));
184
185 u = FN(UNION,cow)(u);
186
187 if (!u)
188 goto error;
189
190 if (FN(UNION,check_disjoint_domain_other)(u, part) < 0)
191 goto error;
192 entry = FN(UNION,find_part_entry)(u, part->dim, 1);
193 if (!entry)
194 goto error;
195
196 if (!entry->data)
197 entry->data = part;
198 else {
199 if (disjoint &&
200 FN(UNION,check_disjoint_domain)(entry->data, part) < 0)
201 goto error;
202 entry->data = FN(PART,union_add_)(entry->data,
203 FN(PART,copy)(part));
204 if (!entry->data)
205 goto error;
206 empty = FN(PART,IS_ZERO)(part);
207 if (empty < 0)
208 goto error;
209 if (empty)
210 u = FN(UNION,remove_part_entry)(u, entry);
211 FN(PART,free)(part);
212 }
213
214 return u;
215error:
216 FN(PART,free)(part);
217 FN(UNION,free)(u);
218 return NULL;
219}
220
221/* Add "part" to "u", where "u" is assumed not to already have
222 * a part that is defined on the same space as "part".
223 */
224__isl_give UNION *FN(FN(UNION,add),BASE)(__isl_take UNION *u,
225 __isl_take PART *part)
226{
227 return FN(UNION,add_part_generic)(u, part, 1);
228}
229
230/* Allocate a UNION with the same type (if any) and the same size as "u" and
231 * with space "space".
232 */
233static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,alloc_same_size_on_space)(__isl_keep UNION *u,
234 __isl_take isl_space *space)
235{
236 if (!u)
237 goto error;
238 return FN(UNION,alloc)(space OPT_TYPE_ARG(u->), u->table.n);
239error:
240 isl_space_free(space);
241 return NULL;
242}
243
244/* Allocate a UNION with the same space, the same type (if any) and
245 * the same size as "u".
246 */
247static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,alloc_same_size)(__isl_keep UNION *u)
248{
249 return FN(UNION,alloc_same_size_on_space)(u, FN(UNION,get_space)(u));
250}
251
252/* Data structure that specifies how isl_union_*_transform
253 * should modify the base expressions in the union expression.
254 *
255 * If "inplace" is set, then the base expression in the input union
256 * are modified in place. This means that "fn" should not
257 * change the meaning of the union or that the union only
258 * has a single reference.
259 * If "space" is not NULL, then a new union is created in this space.
260 * If "filter" is not NULL, then only the base expressions that satisfy "filter"
261 * are taken into account.
262 * "filter_user" is passed as the second argument to "filter".
263 * If "fn" it not NULL, then it is applied to each entry in the input.
264 * "fn_user" is passed as the second argument to "fn".
265 */
266S(UNION,transform_control) {
267 int inplace;
268 isl_space *space;
269 isl_bool (*filter)(__isl_keep PART *part, void *user);
270 void *filter_user;
271 __isl_give PART *(*fn)(__isl_take PART *part, void *user);
272 void *fn_user;
273};
274
275/* Internal data structure for isl_union_*_transform_space.
276 * "control" specifies how the base expressions should be modified.
277 * "res" collects the results (if control->inplace is not set).
278 */
279S(UNION,transform_data)
280{
281 S(UNION,transform_control) *control;
282 UNION *res;
283};
284
285/* Apply control->fn to "part" and add the result to data->res or
286 * place it back into the input union if control->inplace is set.
287 */
288static isl_stat FN(UNION,transform_entry)(void **entry, void *user)
289{
290 S(UNION,transform_data) *data = (S(UNION,transform_data) *)user;
291 S(UNION,transform_control) *control = data->control;
292 PART *part = *entry;
293
294 if (control->filter) {
295 isl_bool handle;
296
297 handle = control->filter(part, control->filter_user);
298 if (handle < 0)
299 return isl_stat_error;
300 if (!handle)
301 return isl_stat_ok;
302 }
303
304 if (!control->inplace)
305 part = FN(PART,copy)(part);
306 if (control->fn)
307 part = control->fn(part, control->fn_user);
308 if (control->inplace)
309 *entry = part;
310 else
311 data->res = FN(FN(UNION,add),BASE)(data->res, part);
312 if (!part || !data->res)
313 return isl_stat_error;
314
315 return isl_stat_ok;
316}
317
318/* Return a UNION that is obtained by modifying "u" according to "control".
319 */
320static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,transform)(__isl_take UNION *u,
321 S(UNION,transform_control) *control)
322{
323 S(UNION,transform_data) data = { control };
324 isl_space *space;
325
326 if (control->inplace) {
327 data.res = u;
328 } else {
329 if (control->space)
330 space = isl_space_copy(control->space);
331 else
332 space = FN(UNION,get_space)(u);
333 data.res = FN(UNION,alloc_same_size_on_space)(u, space);
334 }
335 if (FN(UNION,foreach_inplace)(u, &FN(UNION,transform_entry), &data) < 0)
336 data.res = FN(UNION,free)(data.res);
337 if (!control->inplace)
338 FN(UNION,free)(u);
339 return data.res;
340}
341
342/* Return a UNION living in "space" that is otherwise obtained by modifying "u"
343 * according to "control".
344 */
345static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,transform_space)(__isl_take UNION *u,
346 __isl_take isl_space *space, S(UNION,transform_control) *control)
347{
348 if (!space)
349 return FN(UNION,free)(u);
350 control->space = space;
351 u = FN(UNION,transform)(u, control);
352 isl_space_free(space);
353 return u;
354}
355
356/* Update "u" by applying "fn" to each entry.
357 * This operation is assumed not to change the number of entries nor
358 * the spaces of the entries.
359 *
360 * If there is only one reference to "u", then change "u" inplace.
361 * Otherwise, create a new UNION from "u" and discard the original.
362 */
363static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,transform_inplace)(__isl_take UNION *u,
364 __isl_give PART *(*fn)(__isl_take PART *part, void *user), void *user)
365{
366 S(UNION,transform_control) control = { .fn = fn, .fn_user = user };
367 isl_bool single_ref;
368
369 single_ref = FN(UNION,has_single_reference)(u);
370 if (single_ref < 0)
371 return FN(UNION,free)(u);
372 if (single_ref)
373 control.inplace = 1;
374 return FN(UNION,transform)(u, &control);
375}
376
377/* An isl_union_*_transform callback for use in isl_union_*_dup
378 * that simply returns "part".
379 */
380static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,copy_part)(__isl_take PART *part, void *user)
381{
382 return part;
383}
384
385__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,dup)(__isl_keep UNION *u)
386{
387 S(UNION,transform_control) control = { .fn = &FN(UNION,copy_part) };
388
389 u = FN(UNION,copy)(u);
390 return FN(UNION,transform)(u, &control);
391}
392
393__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,cow)(__isl_take UNION *u)
394{
395 if (!u)
396 return NULL;
397
398 if (u->ref == 1)
399 return u;
400 u->ref--;
401 return FN(UNION,dup)(u);
402}
403
404__isl_null UNION *FN(UNION,free)(__isl_take UNION *u)
405{
406 if (!u)
407 return NULL;
408
409 if (--u->ref > 0)
410 return NULL;
411
412 isl_hash_table_foreach(u->space->ctx, &u->table,
413 &FN(UNION,free_u_entry), NULL);
414 isl_hash_table_clear(&u->table);
415 isl_space_free(u->space);
416 free(u);
417 return NULL;
418}
419
420static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,align_entry)(__isl_take PART *part, void *user)
421{
422 isl_reordering *exp = user;
423
424 exp = isl_reordering_extend_space(isl_reordering_copy(exp),
425 FN(PART,get_domain_space)(part));
426 return FN(PART,realign_domain)(part, exp);
427}
428
429/* Reorder the parameters of "u" according to the given reordering.
430 */
431static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,realign_domain)(__isl_take UNION *u,
432 __isl_take isl_reordering *r)
433{
434 S(UNION,transform_control) control = {
435 .fn = &FN(UNION,align_entry),
436 .fn_user = r,
437 };
438 isl_space *space;
439
440 if (!u || !r)
441 goto error;
442
443 space = isl_reordering_get_space(r);
444 u = FN(UNION,transform_space)(u, space, &control);
445 isl_reordering_free(r);
446 return u;
447error:
448 FN(UNION,free)(u);
449 isl_reordering_free(r);
450 return NULL;
451}
452
453/* Align the parameters of "u" to those of "model".
454 */
455__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,align_params)(__isl_take UNION *u,
456 __isl_take isl_space *model)
457{
458 isl_bool equal_params;
459 isl_reordering *r;
460
461 if (!u || !model)
462 goto error;
463
464 equal_params = isl_space_has_equal_params(u->space, model);
465 if (equal_params < 0)
466 goto error;
467 if (equal_params) {
468 isl_space_free(model);
469 return u;
470 }
471
472 r = isl_parameter_alignment_reordering(u->space, model);
473 isl_space_free(model);
474
475 return FN(UNION,realign_domain)(u, r);
476error:
477 isl_space_free(model);
478 FN(UNION,free)(u);
479 return NULL;
480}
481
482/* Add "part" to *u, taking the union sum if "u" already has
483 * a part defined on the same space as "part".
484 */
485static isl_stat FN(UNION,union_add_part)(__isl_take PART *part, void *user)
486{
487 UNION **u = (UNION **)user;
488
489 *u = FN(UNION,add_part_generic)(*u, part, 0);
490
491 return isl_stat_ok;
492}
493
494/* Compute the sum of "u1" and "u2" on the union of their domains,
495 * with the actual sum on the shared domain and
496 * the defined expression on the symmetric difference of the domains.
497 *
498 * This is an internal function that is exposed under different
499 * names depending on whether the base expressions have a zero default
500 * value.
501 * If they do, then this function is called "add".
502 * Otherwise, it is called "union_add".
503 */
504static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,union_add_)(__isl_take UNION *u1,
505 __isl_take UNION *u2)
506{
507 u1 = FN(UNION,align_params)(u1, FN(UNION,get_space)(u2));
508 u2 = FN(UNION,align_params)(u2, FN(UNION,get_space)(u1));
509
510 u1 = FN(UNION,cow)(u1);
511
512 if (!u1 || !u2)
513 goto error;
514
515 if (FN(FN(UNION,foreach),BASE)(u2, &FN(UNION,union_add_part), &u1) < 0)
516 goto error;
517
518 FN(UNION,free)(u2);
519
520 return u1;
521error:
522 FN(UNION,free)(u1);
523 FN(UNION,free)(u2);
524 return NULL;
525}
526
527__isl_give UNION *FN(FN(UNION,from),BASE)(__isl_take PART *part)
528{
529 isl_space *space;
530 UNION *u;
531
532 if (!part)
533 return NULL;
534
535 space = FN(PART,get_space)(part);
536 space = isl_space_drop_dims(space, isl_dim_in, 0,
537 isl_space_dim(space, isl_dim_in));
538 space = isl_space_drop_dims(space, isl_dim_out, 0,
539 isl_space_dim(space, isl_dim_out));
540 u = FN(UNION,ZERO)(space OPT_TYPE_ARG(part->));
541 u = FN(FN(UNION,add),BASE)(u, part);
542
543 return u;
544}
545
546S(UNION,match_bin_data) {
547 UNION *u2;
548 UNION *res;
549 __isl_give PART *(*fn)(__isl_take PART *, __isl_take PART *);
550};
551
552/* Check if data->u2 has an element living in the same space as "part".
553 * If so, call data->fn on the two elements and add the result to
554 * data->res.
555 */
556static isl_stat FN(UNION,match_bin_entry)(__isl_take PART *part, void *user)
557{
558 S(UNION,match_bin_data) *data = user;
559 struct isl_hash_table_entry *entry2;
560 isl_space *space;
561 PART *part2;
562
563 space = FN(PART,get_space)(part);
564 entry2 = FN(UNION,find_part_entry)(data->u2, space, 0);
565 isl_space_free(space);
566 if (!entry2)
567 goto error;
568 if (entry2 == isl_hash_table_entry_none) {
569 FN(PART,free)(part);
570 return isl_stat_ok;
571 }
572
573 part2 = entry2->data;
574 if (!isl_space_tuple_is_equal(part->dim, isl_dim_out,
575 part2->dim, isl_dim_out))
576 isl_die(FN(UNION,get_ctx)(data->u2), isl_error_invalid,
577 "entries should have the same range space",
578 goto error);
579
580 part = data->fn(part, FN(PART, copy)(entry2->data));
581
582 data->res = FN(FN(UNION,add),BASE)(data->res, part);
583 if (!data->res)
584 return isl_stat_error;
585
586 return isl_stat_ok;
587error:
588 FN(PART,free)(part);
589 return isl_stat_error;
590}
591
592/* This function is currently only used from isl_polynomial.c
593 * and not from isl_fold.c.
594 */
595static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,match_bin_op)(__isl_take UNION *u1,
596 __isl_take UNION *u2,
597 __isl_give PART *(*fn)(__isl_take PART *, __isl_take PART *))
598 __attribute__ ((unused));
599/* For each pair of elements in "u1" and "u2" living in the same space,
600 * call "fn" and collect the results.
601 */
602static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,match_bin_op)(__isl_take UNION *u1,
603 __isl_take UNION *u2,
604 __isl_give PART *(*fn)(__isl_take PART *, __isl_take PART *))
605{
606 S(UNION,match_bin_data) data = { NULL, NULL, fn };
607
608 u1 = FN(UNION,align_params)(u1, FN(UNION,get_space)(u2));
609 u2 = FN(UNION,align_params)(u2, FN(UNION,get_space)(u1));
610
611 if (!u1 || !u2)
612 goto error;
613
614 data.u2 = u2;
615 data.res = FN(UNION,alloc_same_size)(u1);
616 if (FN(FN(UNION,foreach),BASE)(u1,
617 &FN(UNION,match_bin_entry), &data) < 0)
618 goto error;
619
620 FN(UNION,free)(u1);
621 FN(UNION,free)(u2);
622 return data.res;
623error:
624 FN(UNION,free)(u1);
625 FN(UNION,free)(u2);
626 FN(UNION,free)(data.res);
627 return NULL;
628}
629
630/* Compute the sum of "u1" and "u2".
631 *
632 * If the base expressions have a default zero value, then the sum
633 * is computed on the union of the domains of "u1" and "u2".
634 * Otherwise, it is computed on their shared domains.
635 */
636__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,add)(__isl_take UNION *u1, __isl_take UNION *u2)
637{
638#if DEFAULT_IS_ZERO
639 return FN(UNION,union_add_)(u1, u2);
640#else
641 return FN(UNION,match_bin_op)(u1, u2, &FN(PART,add));
642#endif
643}
644
645#ifndef NO_SUB
646/* Subtract "u2" from "u1" and return the result.
647 */
648__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,sub)(__isl_take UNION *u1, __isl_take UNION *u2)
649{
650 return FN(UNION,match_bin_op)(u1, u2, &FN(PART,sub));
651}
652#endif
653
654S(UNION,any_set_data) {
655 isl_set *set;
656 __isl_give PW *(*fn)(__isl_take PW*, __isl_take isl_set*);
657};
658
659static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,any_set_entry)(__isl_take PART *part,
660 void *user)
661{
662 S(UNION,any_set_data) *data = user;
663
664 return data->fn(part, isl_set_copy(data->set));
665}
666
667/* Update each element of "u" by calling "fn" on the element and "set".
668 */
669static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,any_set_op)(__isl_take UNION *u,
670 __isl_take isl_set *set,
671 __isl_give PW *(*fn)(__isl_take PW*, __isl_take isl_set*))
672{
673 S(UNION,any_set_data) data = { NULL, fn };
674 S(UNION,transform_control) control = {
675 .fn = &FN(UNION,any_set_entry),
676 .fn_user = &data,
677 };
678
679 u = FN(UNION,align_params)(u, isl_set_get_space(set));
680 set = isl_set_align_params(set, FN(UNION,get_space)(u));
681
682 if (!u || !set)
683 goto error;
684
685 data.set = set;
686 u = FN(UNION,transform)(u, &control);
687 isl_set_free(set);
688 return u;
689error:
690 FN(UNION,free)(u);
691 isl_set_free(set);
692 return NULL;
693}
694
695/* Intersect the domain of "u" with the parameter domain "context".
696 */
697__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,intersect_params)(__isl_take UNION *u,
698 __isl_take isl_set *set)
699{
700 return FN(UNION,any_set_op)(u, set, &FN(PW,intersect_params));
701}
702
703/* Compute the gist of the domain of "u" with respect to
704 * the parameter domain "context".
705 */
706__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,gist_params)(__isl_take UNION *u,
707 __isl_take isl_set *set)
708{
709 return FN(UNION,any_set_op)(u, set, &FN(PW,gist_params));
710}
711
712/* Data structure that specifies how isl_union_*_match_domain_op
713 * should combine its arguments.
714 *
715 * If "filter" is not NULL, then only parts that pass the given
716 * filter are considered for matching.
717 * "fn" is applied to each part in the union and each corresponding
718 * set in the union set, i.e., such that the set lives in the same space
719 * as the domain of the part.
720 * If "match_space" is not NULL, then the set extracted from the union set
721 * does not live in the same space as the domain of the part,
722 * but rather in the space that results from calling "match_space"
723 * on this domain space.
724 */
725S(UNION,match_domain_control) {
726 isl_bool (*filter)(__isl_keep PART *part);
727 __isl_give isl_space *(*match_space)(__isl_take isl_space *space);
728 __isl_give PW *(*fn)(__isl_take PW*, __isl_take isl_set*);
729};
730
731S(UNION,match_domain_data) {
732 isl_union_set *uset;
733 UNION *res;
734 S(UNION,match_domain_control) *control;
735};
736
737/* Find the set in data->uset that lives in the same space as the domain
738 * of "part" (ignoring parameters), apply data->fn to *entry and this set
739 * (if any), and add the result to data->res.
740 */
741static isl_stat FN(UNION,match_domain_entry)(__isl_take PART *part, void *user)
742{
743 S(UNION,match_domain_data) *data = user;
744 struct isl_hash_table_entry *entry2;
745 isl_space *space;
746
747 if (data->control->filter) {
748 isl_bool pass = data->control->filter(part);
749 if (pass < 0 || !pass) {
750 FN(PART,free)(part);
751 return pass < 0 ? isl_stat_error : isl_stat_ok;
752 }
753 }
754
755 space = FN(PART,get_domain_space)(part);
756 if (data->control->match_space)
757 space = data->control->match_space(space);
758 entry2 = isl_union_set_find_entry(data->uset, space, 0);
759 isl_space_free(space);
760 if (!entry2 || entry2 == isl_hash_table_entry_none) {
761 FN(PART,free)(part);
762 return isl_stat_non_null(entry2);
763 }
764
765 part = data->control->fn(part, isl_set_copy(entry2->data));
766
767 data->res = FN(FN(UNION,add),BASE)(data->res, part);
768 if (!data->res)
769 return isl_stat_error;
770
771 return isl_stat_ok;
772}
773
774/* Combine "u" and "uset" according to "control"
775 * and collect the results.
776 */
777static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,match_domain_op)(__isl_take UNION *u,
778 __isl_take isl_union_set *uset, S(UNION,match_domain_control) *control)
779{
780 S(UNION,match_domain_data) data = { NULL, NULL, control };
781
782 if (!u || !uset)
783 goto error;
784
785 data.uset = uset;
786 data.res = FN(UNION,alloc_same_size)(u);
787 if (FN(FN(UNION,foreach),BASE)(u,
788 &FN(UNION,match_domain_entry), &data) < 0)
789 goto error;
790
791 FN(UNION,free)(u);
792 isl_union_set_free(uset);
793 return data.res;
794error:
795 FN(UNION,free)(u);
796 isl_union_set_free(uset);
797 FN(UNION,free)(data.res);
798 return NULL;
799}
800
801/* Intersect the domain of "u" with "uset".
802 * If "uset" is a parameters domain, then intersect the parameter
803 * domain of "u" with this set.
804 */
805__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,intersect_domain_union_set)(__isl_take UNION *u,
806 __isl_take isl_union_set *uset)
807{
808 S(UNION,match_domain_control) control = {
809 .fn = &FN(PW,intersect_domain),
810 };
811
812 if (isl_union_set_is_params(uset))
813 return FN(UNION,intersect_params)(u,
814 isl_set_from_union_set(uset));
815 return FN(UNION,match_domain_op)(u, uset, &control);
816}
817
818/* This is an alternative name for the function above.
819 */
820__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,intersect_domain)(__isl_take UNION *u,
821 __isl_take isl_union_set *uset)
822{
823 return FN(UNION,intersect_domain_union_set)(u, uset);
824}
825
826/* Return true if this part should be kept.
827 *
828 * In particular, it should be kept if its domain space
829 * corresponds to "space".
830 */
831static isl_bool FN(UNION,select_entry)(__isl_keep PART *part, void *user)
832{
833 isl_space *space = user;
834
835 return FN(PW,has_domain_space_tuples)(part, space);
836}
837
838/* Remove any not element in "space" from the domain of "u".
839 *
840 * In particular, select any part of the function defined
841 * on this domain space.
842 */
843__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,intersect_domain_space)(__isl_take UNION *u,
844 __isl_take isl_space *space)
845{
846 S(UNION,transform_control) control = {
847 .filter = &FN(UNION,select_entry),
848 .filter_user = space,
849 };
850
851 u = FN(UNION,transform)(u, &control);
852 isl_space_free(space);
853 return u;
854}
855
856/* Is the domain of "pw" a wrapped relation?
857 */
858static isl_bool FN(PW,domain_is_wrapping)(__isl_keep PW *pw)
859{
860 return isl_space_domain_is_wrapping(FN(PW,peek_space)(pw));
861}
862
863/* Intersect the domain of the wrapped relation inside the domain of "u"
864 * with "uset".
865 */
866__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,intersect_domain_wrapped_domain)(__isl_take UNION *u,
867 __isl_take isl_union_set *uset)
868{
869 S(UNION,match_domain_control) control = {
870 .filter = &FN(PART,domain_is_wrapping),
871 .match_space = &isl_space_factor_domain,
872 .fn = &FN(PW,intersect_domain_wrapped_domain),
873 };
874
875 return FN(UNION,match_domain_op)(u, uset, &control);
876}
877
878/* Intersect the range of the wrapped relation inside the domain of "u"
879 * with "uset".
880 */
881__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,intersect_domain_wrapped_range)(__isl_take UNION *u,
882 __isl_take isl_union_set *uset)
883{
884 S(UNION,match_domain_control) control = {
885 .filter = &FN(PART,domain_is_wrapping),
886 .match_space = &isl_space_factor_range,
887 .fn = &FN(PW,intersect_domain_wrapped_range),
888 };
889
890 return FN(UNION,match_domain_op)(u, uset, &control);
891}
892
893/* Take the set (which may be empty) in data->uset that lives
894 * in the same space as the domain of "pw", subtract it from the domain
895 * of "part" and return the result.
896 */
897static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,subtract_domain_entry)(__isl_take PART *part,
898 void *user)
899{
900 isl_union_set *uset = user;
901 isl_space *space;
902 isl_set *set;
903
904 space = FN(PART,get_domain_space)(part);
905 set = isl_union_set_extract_set(uset, space);
906 return FN(PART,subtract_domain)(part, set);
907}
908
909/* Subtract "uset" from the domain of "u".
910 */
911__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,subtract_domain_union_set)(__isl_take UNION *u,
912 __isl_take isl_union_set *uset)
913{
914 S(UNION,transform_control) control = {
915 .fn = &FN(UNION,subtract_domain_entry),
916 .fn_user = uset,
917 };
918
919 u = FN(UNION,transform)(u, &control);
920 isl_union_set_free(uset);
921 return u;
922}
923
924/* This is an alternative name for the function above.
925 */
926__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,subtract_domain)(__isl_take UNION *u,
927 __isl_take isl_union_set *uset)
928{
929 return FN(UNION,subtract_domain_union_set)(u, uset);
930}
931
932/* Return true if this part should be kept.
933 *
934 * In particular, it should be kept if its domain space
935 * does not correspond to "space".
936 */
937static isl_bool FN(UNION,filter_out_entry)(__isl_keep PART *part, void *user)
938{
939 isl_space *space = user;
940
941 return isl_bool_not(FN(PW,has_domain_space_tuples)(part, space));
942}
943
944/* Remove any element in "space" from the domain of "u".
945 *
946 * In particular, filter out any part of the function defined
947 * on this domain space.
948 */
949__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,subtract_domain_space)(__isl_take UNION *u,
950 __isl_take isl_space *space)
951{
952 S(UNION,transform_control) control = {
953 .filter = &FN(UNION,filter_out_entry),
954 .filter_user = space,
955 };
956
957 u = FN(UNION,transform)(u, &control);
958 isl_space_free(space);
959 return u;
960}
961
962__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,gist)(__isl_take UNION *u,
963 __isl_take isl_union_set *uset)
964{
965 S(UNION,match_domain_control) control = {
966 .fn = &FN(PW,gist),
967 };
968
969 if (isl_union_set_is_params(uset))
970 return FN(UNION,gist_params)(u, isl_set_from_union_set(uset));
971 return FN(UNION,match_domain_op)(u, uset, &control);
972}
973
974/* Coalesce an entry in a UNION. Coalescing is performed in-place.
975 * Since the UNION may have several references, the entry is only
976 * replaced if the coalescing is successful.
977 */
978static isl_stat FN(UNION,coalesce_entry)(void **entry, void *user)
979{
980 PART **part_p = (PART **) entry;
981 PART *part;
982
983 part = FN(PART,copy)(*part_p);
984 part = FN(PW,coalesce)(part);
985 if (!part)
986 return isl_stat_error;
987 FN(PART,free)(*part_p);
988 *part_p = part;
989
990 return isl_stat_ok;
991}
992
993__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,coalesce)(__isl_take UNION *u)
994{
995 if (FN(UNION,foreach_inplace)(u, &FN(UNION,coalesce_entry), NULL) < 0)
996 goto error;
997
998 return u;
999error:
1000 FN(UNION,free)(u);
1001 return NULL;
1002}
1003
1004static isl_stat FN(UNION,domain_entry)(__isl_take PART *part, void *user)
1005{
1006 isl_union_set **uset = (isl_union_set **)user;
1007
1008 *uset = isl_union_set_add_set(*uset, FN(PART,domain)(part));
1009
1010 return isl_stat_ok;
1011}
1012
1013__isl_give isl_union_set *FN(UNION,domain)(__isl_take UNION *u)
1014{
1015 isl_union_set *uset;
1016
1017 uset = isl_union_set_empty(FN(UNION,get_space)(u));
1018 if (FN(FN(UNION,foreach),BASE)(u, &FN(UNION,domain_entry), &uset) < 0)
1019 goto error;
1020
1021 FN(UNION,free)(u);
1022
1023 return uset;
1024error:
1025 isl_union_set_free(uset);
1026 FN(UNION,free)(u);
1027 return NULL;
1028}
1029
1030#ifdef HAS_TYPE
1031/* Negate the type of "u".
1032 */
1033static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,negate_type)(__isl_take UNION *u)
1034{
1035 u = FN(UNION,cow)(u);
1036 if (!u)
1037 return NULL;
1038 u->type = isl_fold_type_negate(u->type);
1039 return u;
1040}
1041#else
1042/* Negate the type of "u".
1043 * Since "u" does not have a type, do nothing.
1044 */
1045static __isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,negate_type)(__isl_take UNION *u)
1046{
1047 return u;
1048}
1049#endif
1050
1051/* Multiply "part" by the isl_val "user" and return the result.
1052 */
1053static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,scale_val_entry)(__isl_take PART *part,
1054 void *user)
1055{
1056 isl_val *v = user;
1057
1058 return FN(PART,scale_val)(part, isl_val_copy(v));
1059}
1060
1061/* Multiply "u" by "v" and return the result.
1062 */
1063__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,scale_val)(__isl_take UNION *u,
1064 __isl_take isl_val *v)
1065{
1066 if (!u || !v)
1067 goto error;
1068 if (isl_val_is_one(v)) {
1069 isl_val_free(v);
1070 return u;
1071 }
1072
1073 if (DEFAULT_IS_ZERO && u && isl_val_is_zero(v)) {
1074 UNION *zero;
1075 isl_space *space = FN(UNION,get_space)(u);
1076 zero = FN(UNION,ZERO)(space OPT_TYPE_ARG(u->));
1077 FN(UNION,free)(u);
1078 isl_val_free(v);
1079 return zero;
1080 }
1081
1082 if (!isl_val_is_rat(v))
1083 isl_die(isl_val_get_ctx(v), isl_error_invalid,
1084 "expecting rational factor", goto error);
1085
1086 u = FN(UNION,transform_inplace)(u, &FN(UNION,scale_val_entry), v);
1087 if (isl_val_is_neg(v))
1088 u = FN(UNION,negate_type)(u);
1089
1090 isl_val_free(v);
1091 return u;
1092error:
1093 isl_val_free(v);
1094 FN(UNION,free)(u);
1095 return NULL;
1096}
1097
1098/* Divide "part" by the isl_val "user" and return the result.
1099 */
1100static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,scale_down_val_entry)(__isl_take PART *part,
1101 void *user)
1102{
1103 isl_val *v = user;
1104
1105 return FN(PART,scale_down_val)(part, isl_val_copy(v));
1106}
1107
1108/* Divide "u" by "v" and return the result.
1109 */
1110__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,scale_down_val)(__isl_take UNION *u,
1111 __isl_take isl_val *v)
1112{
1113 if (!u || !v)
1114 goto error;
1115 if (isl_val_is_one(v)) {
1116 isl_val_free(v);
1117 return u;
1118 }
1119
1120 if (!isl_val_is_rat(v))
1121 isl_die(isl_val_get_ctx(v), isl_error_invalid,
1122 "expecting rational factor", goto error);
1123 if (isl_val_is_zero(v))
1124 isl_die(isl_val_get_ctx(v), isl_error_invalid,
1125 "cannot scale down by zero", goto error);
1126
1127 u = FN(UNION,transform_inplace)(u, &FN(UNION,scale_down_val_entry), v);
1128 if (isl_val_is_neg(v))
1129 u = FN(UNION,negate_type)(u);
1130
1131 isl_val_free(v);
1132 return u;
1133error:
1134 isl_val_free(v);
1135 FN(UNION,free)(u);
1136 return NULL;
1137}
1138
1139/* Internal data structure for isl_union_*_every_*.
1140 *
1141 * "test" is the user-specified callback function.
1142 * "user" is the user-specified callback function argument.
1143 *
1144 * "res" is the final result, initialized to isl_bool_true.
1145 */
1146S(UNION,every_data) {
1147 isl_bool (*test)(__isl_keep PW *pw, void *user);
1148 void *user;
1149
1150 isl_bool res;
1151};
1152
1153/* Call data->test on the piecewise expression at *entry,
1154 * updating the result in data->res.
1155 * Abort if this result is no longer isl_bool_true.
1156 */
1157static isl_stat FN(UNION,every_entry)(void **entry, void *user)
1158{
1159 S(UNION,every_data) *data = user;
1160 PW *pw = *entry;
1161
1162 data->res = data->test(pw, data->user);
1163 if (data->res < 0 || !data->res)
1164 return isl_stat_error;
1165
1166 return isl_stat_ok;
1167}
1168
1169/* Does "test" succeed on every piecewise expression in "u"?
1170 */
1171isl_bool FN(FN(UNION,every),BASE)(__isl_keep UNION *u,
1172 isl_bool (*test)(__isl_keep PW *pw, void *user), void *user)
1173{
1174 S(UNION,every_data) data = { test, user };
1175
1176 data.res = isl_bool_true;
1177 if (FN(UNION,foreach_inplace)(u, &FN(UNION,every_entry), &data) < 0 &&
1178 data.res == isl_bool_true)
1179 return isl_bool_error;
1180
1181 return data.res;
1182}
1183
1184S(UNION,plain_is_equal_data)
1185{
1186 UNION *u2;
1187};
1188
1189static isl_bool FN(UNION,plain_is_equal_el)(__isl_keep PW *pw, void *user)
1190{
1191 S(UNION,plain_is_equal_data) *data = user;
1192 struct isl_hash_table_entry *entry;
1193
1194 entry = FN(UNION,find_part_entry)(data->u2, pw->dim, 0);
1195 if (!entry)
1196 return isl_bool_error;
1197 if (entry == isl_hash_table_entry_none)
1198 return isl_bool_false;
1199
1200 return FN(PW,plain_is_equal)(pw, entry->data);
1201}
1202
1203isl_bool FN(UNION,plain_is_equal)(__isl_keep UNION *u1, __isl_keep UNION *u2)
1204{
1205 S(UNION,plain_is_equal_data) data;
1206 isl_size n1, n2;
1207 isl_bool is_equal;
1208
1209 if (!u1 || !u2)
1210 return isl_bool_error;
1211 if (u1 == u2)
1212 return isl_bool_true;
1213 if (u1->table.n != u2->table.n)
1214 return isl_bool_false;
1215 n1 = FN(FN(UNION,n),BASE)(u1);
1216 n2 = FN(FN(UNION,n),BASE)(u2);
1217 if (n1 < 0 || n2 < 0)
1218 return isl_bool_error;
1219 if (n1 != n2)
1220 return isl_bool_false;
1221
1222 u1 = FN(UNION,copy)(u1);
1223 u2 = FN(UNION,copy)(u2);
1224 u1 = FN(UNION,align_params)(u1, FN(UNION,get_space)(u2));
1225 u2 = FN(UNION,align_params)(u2, FN(UNION,get_space)(u1));
1226 if (!u1 || !u2)
1227 goto error;
1228
1229 data.u2 = u2;
1230 is_equal = FN(FN(UNION,every),BASE)(u1,
1231 &FN(UNION,plain_is_equal_el), &data);
1232
1233 FN(UNION,free)(u1);
1234 FN(UNION,free)(u2);
1235
1236 return is_equal;
1237error:
1238 FN(UNION,free)(u1);
1239 FN(UNION,free)(u2);
1240 return isl_bool_error;
1241}
1242
1243/* An isl_union_*_every_* callback that checks whether "pw"
1244 * does not involve any NaNs.
1245 */
1246static isl_bool FN(UNION,no_nan_el)(__isl_keep PW *pw, void *user)
1247{
1248 return isl_bool_not(FN(PW,involves_nan)(pw));
1249}
1250
1251/* Does "u" involve any NaNs?
1252 */
1253isl_bool FN(UNION,involves_nan)(__isl_keep UNION *u)
1254{
1255 isl_bool no_nan;
1256
1257 no_nan = FN(FN(UNION,every),BASE)(u, &FN(UNION,no_nan_el), NULL);
1258
1259 return isl_bool_not(no_nan);
1260}
1261
1262/* Internal data structure for isl_union_*_drop_dims.
1263 * type, first and n are passed to isl_*_drop_dims.
1264 */
1265S(UNION,drop_dims_data) {
1266 enum isl_dim_type type;
1267 unsigned first;
1268 unsigned n;
1269};
1270
1271/* Drop the parameters specified by "data" from "part" and return the result.
1272 */
1273static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,drop_dims_entry)(__isl_take PART *part,
1274 void *user)
1275{
1276 S(UNION,drop_dims_data) *data = user;
1277
1278 return FN(PART,drop_dims)(part, data->type, data->first, data->n);
1279}
1280
1281/* Drop the specified parameters from "u".
1282 * That is, type is required to be isl_dim_param.
1283 */
1284__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,drop_dims)( __isl_take UNION *u,
1285 enum isl_dim_type type, unsigned first, unsigned n)
1286{
1287 isl_space *space;
1288 S(UNION,drop_dims_data) data = { type, first, n };
1289 S(UNION,transform_control) control = {
1290 .fn = &FN(UNION,drop_dims_entry),
1291 .fn_user = &data,
1292 };
1293
1294 if (!u)
1295 return NULL;
1296
1297 if (type != isl_dim_param)
1298 isl_die(FN(UNION,get_ctx)(u), isl_error_invalid,
1299 "can only project out parameters",
1300 return FN(UNION,free)(u));
1301
1302 space = FN(UNION,get_space)(u);
1303 space = isl_space_drop_dims(space, type, first, n);
1304 return FN(UNION,transform_space)(u, space, &control);
1305}
1306
1307/* Internal data structure for isl_union_*_set_dim_name.
1308 * pos is the position of the parameter that needs to be renamed.
1309 * s is the new name.
1310 */
1311S(UNION,set_dim_name_data) {
1312 unsigned pos;
1313 const char *s;
1314};
1315
1316/* Change the name of the parameter at position data->pos of "part" to data->s
1317 * and return the result.
1318 */
1319static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,set_dim_name_entry)(__isl_take PART *part,
1320 void *user)
1321{
1322 S(UNION,set_dim_name_data) *data = user;
1323
1324 return FN(PART,set_dim_name)(part, isl_dim_param, data->pos, data->s);
1325}
1326
1327/* Change the name of the parameter at position "pos" to "s".
1328 * That is, type is required to be isl_dim_param.
1329 */
1330__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,set_dim_name)(__isl_take UNION *u,
1331 enum isl_dim_type type, unsigned pos, const char *s)
1332{
1333 S(UNION,set_dim_name_data) data = { pos, s };
1334 S(UNION,transform_control) control = {
1335 .fn = &FN(UNION,set_dim_name_entry),
1336 .fn_user = &data,
1337 };
1338 isl_space *space;
1339
1340 if (!u)
1341 return NULL;
1342
1343 if (type != isl_dim_param)
1344 isl_die(FN(UNION,get_ctx)(u), isl_error_invalid,
1345 "can only set parameter names",
1346 return FN(UNION,free)(u));
1347
1348 space = FN(UNION,get_space)(u);
1349 space = isl_space_set_dim_name(space, type, pos, s);
1350 return FN(UNION,transform_space)(u, space, &control);
1351}
1352
1353/* Reset the user pointer on all identifiers of parameters and tuples
1354 * of the space of "part" and return the result.
1355 */
1356static __isl_give PART *FN(UNION,reset_user_entry)(__isl_take PART *part,
1357 void *user)
1358{
1359 return FN(PART,reset_user)(part);
1360}
1361
1362/* Reset the user pointer on all identifiers of parameters and tuples
1363 * of the spaces of "u".
1364 */
1365__isl_give UNION *FN(UNION,reset_user)(__isl_take UNION *u)
1366{
1367 S(UNION,transform_control) control = {
1368 .fn = &FN(UNION,reset_user_entry),
1369 };
1370 isl_space *space;
1371
1372 space = FN(UNION,get_space)(u);
1373 space = isl_space_reset_user(space);
1374 return FN(UNION,transform_space)(u, space, &control);
1375}
1376
1377/* Add the base expression held by "entry" to "list".
1378 */
1379static isl_stat FN(UNION,add_to_list)(void **entry, void *user)
1380{
1381 PW *pw = *entry;
1382 LIST(PART) **list = user;
1383
1384 *list = FN(LIST(PART),add)(*list, FN(PART,copy)(pw));
1385 if (!*list)
1386 return isl_stat_error;
1387
1388 return isl_stat_ok;
1389}
1390
1391/* Return a list containing all the base expressions in "u".
1392 *
1393 * First construct a list of the appropriate size and
1394 * then add all the elements.
1395 */
1396__isl_give LIST(PART) *FN(FN(UNION,get),LIST(BASE))(__isl_keep UNION *u)
1397{
1398 isl_size n;
1399 LIST(PART) *list;
1400
1401 if (!u)
1402 return NULL;
1403 n = FN(FN(UNION,n),BASE)(u);
1404 if (n < 0)
1405 return NULL;
1406 list = FN(LIST(PART),alloc)(FN(UNION,get_ctx(u)), n);
1407 if (FN(UNION,foreach_inplace)(u, &FN(UNION,add_to_list), &list) < 0)
1408 return FN(LIST(PART),free)(list);
1409
1410 return list;
1411}
